str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Descent. From katabaino; a declivity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
An olive tree; the Mount of Olives. Feminine of a presumed derivative from an obsolete primary; an olive.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
All, the whole, altogether. Absolutely all or every one.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To praise. From ainos; to praise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
